str2: A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a writing, (b) a passage of scripture; plur: the scriptures. A document, i.e. Holy Writ.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say previously, predict, proclaim, foretell. From pro and epo; to say already, to predict.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
Of Hebrew origin; Judas, the name of ten Israelites; also of the posterity of one of them and its region.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A leader, guide; met: an instructor, teacher. From hodos and hegeomai; a conductor (teacher).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and lambano; to clasp, i.e. Seize; specially, to conceive; by implication, to aid.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
